conclusion: Need to understand how shadows change when the light source is moved.
A is the shadow of the blue object.
B is the shadow of the egg.
C is the shadow of the typewriter.
D is the shadow of the white box.
Moving the light source changes direction and intensity of light affecting shadows.
Moving light source to back left changes angle of light, altering shadow direction and length.
Moving light source to back right changes angle of light, altering shadow direction and length.
If light source is moved to back left, shadows shift towards front right.
Size of shadows decreases when light source is moved to back left.
If light source is moved to back right, shadows shift towards front left.
Size of shadows decreases when light source is moved to back right.
A will move to front right and become smaller.
B will move to front left and become smaller.
C will move to front right and become smaller.
D will move to front left and become smaller.
Final answer: Shadows move to front right and become smaller when light source is moved to back left.
Final answer: Shadows move to front left and become smaller when light source is moved to back right.
